title: LG, Whirlpool Target Customers Disconnected From ‘Smart’ Appliances

last_post.content: Less than half of #IoT things in the home remain connected to the Internet. The killer quote from the article? "The challenge is that a consumer doesn’t see the true value that manufacturers see in terms of how that data can help them in the long run. So they don’t really care for spending time to just connect it." Yup, because right now most smart things in the home benefit the manufacturer more than the consumer. #security #privacy https://www.wsj.com/articles/lg-whirlpool-target-customers-disconnected-from-smart-appliances-11674232811

Synth genius Wendy Carlos studied physics & #music at Brown & Columbia. She helped develop the first Moog synthesizer & her 1968 classical album Switched-On Bach went platinum. She brought music & tech together & composed soundtracks for A Clockwork Orange, The Shining, Tron & more.

Carlos was assigned male at birth & transitioned to female. Unfortunately, many journalists focus more on her gender than her accomplishments that changed music forever. https://www.wendycarlos.com #history

Here are the lighthouses of Europe.

The map is even better than it might seem at first glance: the colors are the real colors, the patterns are the real patterns, and the size of the dots is the distance at which each light is visible.

Made with @openstreetmap, Leaflet, and the Overpass API.

https://geodienst.github.io/lighthousemap/

From the Geodienst researchers of Groningen University (NL), via Ethan Mollick

#lighthouse #geojson #openstreetmap #map

Three years ago I published MAdB, a Location Intelligence web app that tries to raise public awareness of the short-term effects of road traffic #noise on people's #health. You can wander around #Madrid and check the noise levels impacting any built unit, the attributable health risks and compare night/day values or the most/least affected facade.

Limitations: Spanish only & desktop only

https://madb.netlify.app

title: Taff Vale Rly Co v Amalgamated Society of Rly Servants - Wikipedia

last_post.content:
This week's substack essay will be on the Taff Vale Railway Case of 1901.

This decision caused outrage, for the House of Lords held that trade unions were responsible for the damages caused to employers by strikes.

The reaction against decision was the origin of modern trade union law - and also of the Labour party itself.

The essay will be published this weekend.

Its wiki entry:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taff_Vale_Rly_Co_v_Amalgamated_Society_of_Rly_Servants

The case report is here: https://www.bailii.org/uk/cases/UKHL/1901/1.html

Subscribe at https://lawandlore.substack.com/

A broadside with a figure of Death aiming with a crossbow at the viewer. Highlighted are the 3 bolts: the first is labelled Heute (today); a used and broken one labelled Gestern (yesterday) lies at the ground. And there is the third bolt waiting in the quiver for Morgen (tomorrow).

Access the #broadside that was published by the Cologne printer Gerhard Altzenbach around 1650 here: https://www.britishmuseum.org/collection/object/P_1876-0510-506

#histodons #history #BookHistory

title: With Trump returing to Musk's Twitter, it's time to get strategic

last_post.content:
Ultimately, it will prove impossible to beat Elon Musk by remaining on the platform he controls.

He and his goons control the most powerful aspects of the site. They can, and will, use it to empower authoritarianism, hate, misinformation and white supremacy.

They are just getting started. By continuing to operate within the framework they control, you will be at a disadvantage. More at FrameLab:

https://framelab.substack.com/p/with-trump-returing-to-musks-twitter

Research papers increasingly refer to websites like GitHub for code, which may be a problem...

About 20% of preprints referred to GitHub in 2021. Yet, these web pages are often not archived, jeopardizing their long-term availability.

"The growing use of Git Hosting Platforms in scholarly publications points to an urgent and growing need for dedicated efforts to archive their holdings in order to preserve research code"

via https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2208.04895
#OpenScience #OpenSource @academicchatter

title: Revealed: more than 90% of rainforest carbon offsets by biggest provider are worthless, analysis shows

last_post.content:
#Environment rant at this article:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/jan/18/revealed-forest-carbon-offsets-biggest-provider-worthless-verra-aoe

Great article and investigation but come on! How are we surprised at this!

'This area will totally be deforested, we'll protect it and that's a carbon offset' = reducing hypothetical future emissions doesnt help with the real ones!
To be fair the UN does the same on their platform: "give money to this solar panel's operator cause it's better than coal" but no coal is actually displaced...
Research your carbon offsets better everyone 🙂

Notice how @davekarpf is using the view count that Elon just pushed for, the exact thing I predicted the day after it launched was going to make people realize how little engagement they are getting on the platform, and realize it's worthless.

View count doesn't measure ANYTHING about a Tweet or its author, it's solely a reflection of the algorithm itself, and how much it's amping or deamping someone's posts.

Twitter launched a feature that tells on itself.

title: Pepper spray for the school run? The weaponised SUV set to terrify America’s streets

last_post.content:
With the new Reznavi 'Vengeance' we have reached SUV Maximalism, and peak everything horrible about car culture. Intended for the US domestic market, it has bullet proof glass, blinding strobe lights, and wing mirrors that shoot pepper spray. Unlike other beat-around-the-bush 'road warrior' SUV makers, the Reznavi configures the urban environment as an actual battlefield, providing driver and passengers with assault vests, helmets, gas masks & a tactical intercom system

title: Nevada Governor Turns to Lobbyist Tied to COVID Lab Scandal for Help With Budget

last_post.content:
“During his contentious campaign to become Nevada governor, Joe Lombardo accused the Democratic incumbent of catering to the family of a donor and their lobbyist who helped an error-prone COVID-19 testing lab get licensed in the state.
“Shortly after he won the race, Lombardo, a Republican, quietly turned to that same lobbyist for help building the state budget, giving him access to confidential documents and putting him in a position that allowed him to advocate for state funding sought by his clients.”
https://www.propublica.org/article/nevada-lombardo-northshore-covid-sisolak-willden

You should read @Mer__edith's thread on all this,¹ and it's worth remembering what @signalapp does and does not do.

Signal does not protect you from:
• an untrustworthy chat partner
• a compromised device
• corporate device management
• your device's Operating System

Signal does protect you from:
• a hack of the Signal servers
• a subpoena of the Signal servers
• the wire between you and the Signal servers
• the employees at Signal

¹ https://mastodon.world/@Mer__edith/109751701529562752

"They Rule" (by Josh On) is an interactive visualization of the people on the of directors at the 100 largest companies. The map lets you see explore how companies' boards interconnect and overlap.

It's built on top of Wikidata APIs, with descriptions from Wikipedia. Nicely done! (I do wonder why it queries US data only... the information mapped by the multilingual Wikidata community is worldwide!)

https://theyrule.net/

title: Appliance makers sad that 50% of customers won’t connect smart appliances

last_post.content:
People don't connect their smart devices to corporate servers. What a complete surprise! 😉 Two culprits here:
1. Lack of trust
2. Lack of robust connectivity (e.g. wifi details change and they don't reconnect)

Both of these are fundamentally #UXDesign issues

https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2023/01/half-of-smart-appliances-remain-disconnected-from-internet-makers-lament/

Here is how #platforms die: first, they are good to their users; then they abuse their users to make things better for their business customers; finally, they abuse those business customers to claw back all the value for themselves. Then, they die.

This is a really interesting study. When Black newborns are cared for by Black physicians, their "clinical penalty" that is the difference in mortality from white newborns is halved.

What's fascinating, if you dive in, is that this is despite the fact that Black physicians tend to have higher caseloads, and also tend to serve more underresourced patients.

Things that make you go hmmmmm...

https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1913405117

HT: @TheRaDR

Just read Peter Staley's incredible memoir, "Never Silent: ACT UP and My Life in Activism."

From the first chapter where Staley &co social-engineer their way into the NYSE and troll the heck out of a bunch of Wall Street traders, to the closing chapter on his friendship with Fauci, it's a really moving tour de force of a history of the HIV/AIDS pandemic and the activism around it.

The audiobook is super worth a listen – it's read by the author. He's an engaging storyteller and quite good at accents.

Here's where to find it: https://openlibrary.org/works/OL25315941W/Never_Silent or you can read an excerpt here: https://www.poz.com/article/searching-actup-peter-staley

#lgbt #queer #queerhistory #activism #aids #memoir #autobiography #pandemic #books #bookstodon

title: If The AI Lawyer You Built Can’t Keep You Out Of Jail, Maybe It’s Time To Hire A Real Lawyer

title: Closing Central Madrid To Cars Resulted In 9.5% Boost To Retail Spending, Finds Bank Analysis

last_post.content:
This is important — closing Central #Madrid to cars over holidays resulted in a 9.5% boost in retail spending on its main shopping street: STUDY.

There was also a 71% drop in air pollution.

Via @carltonreid in Forbes. #citymakingmath #citiesforpeople #cities #cars #streets #urbanism #Spain

https://www.forbes.com/sites/carltonreid/2019/03/08/closing-central-madrid-to-cars-resulted-in-9-5-boost-to-retail-spending-finds-bank-analysis/

title: Ian Schweitzer Exonerated of Murder After 25 Years in Hawaii -

last_post.content: Yesterday on the Big Island of #Hawai'i Ian Schweitzer was #exonerated after 25 years in prison. Mr. Schwitzer was exonerated based on new DNA evidence, new tire tread evidence, and the refutation of junk science bite mark evidence. His original conviction was based largely on jailhouse informant testimony. Mr. Schwitzer was represented by the #InnocenceProject and the #HawaiiInnocenceProject. https://innocenceproject.org/ian-schweitzers-exonerated-murder-25-years-hawaii/ #law #lawfedi #CriminalJustice #CriminalLegalReform #WrongfulConviction @law

"-it was easier to raise capital if what you’re doing sounds high tech and complicated. Really it was a flywheel of people being able to raise money by sounding complicated and smart, and then spending that money on people who made them feel like they could help solve a hard problem in a complicated and smart way, with everyone getting paid and emotionally validated along the way. We’ve developed an aesthetics of complexity: the sense that a good system is a complex one" https://laughingmeme.org/2023/01/23/software-and-its-discontents-part-2-complexity.html

title: Mp3tag: the universal Tag Editor for Mac

especially looking forward to spending that $10/mo on an album from bandcamp instead.

only 'problem' i've found is that many of my MP3s have incorrect tags (album art, artist, etc.) and Doppler isn't the tool for fixing that. But https://mp3tag.app/ is a good option here, and leaves my music collection in much better shape than it started out.

title: Study Shows Value of Coordinated Offshore Wind Planning

last_post.content:
At least $20 billion in transmission-related cost savings
60-70% fewer shore crossings and necessary onshore transmissions upgrades
Approximately 50% fewer miles of marine transmission cable installations disturbing the seabed
More competitive procurement outcomes
Increased consumer savings
Enhanced reliability and grid resilience, and
More timely investments in the local clean energy economy

https://www.nrdc.org/experts/cullen-howe/study-shows-value-coordinated-offshore-wind-planning

title: Improving PagerDuty’s Operational Resilience to Achieve our Long Term Vision and Goals

last_post.content:
In our book Calling Bullshit, we write about corporate weaselspeak and the way that it hides an often terrible human toll behind a smokescreen of jargon and passive voice.

Today's layoff announcement emailed to all PagerDuty employees is destined to become known as a classic of the genre.

title: Call for Papers - New Approaches for Extracting Heterogeneous Reference Data

last_post.content:
I see that the Max Planck Institute for Legal History and Legal Theory has issued a CFP for a “hybrid workshop on New Approaches for Extracting Heterogeneous Reference Data” to be held 15-16 May 2023: “... we want to define the problem(s), establish the state of the art and share resources” for "extracting heterogeneous references from texts, in particular from historical documents and humanities or legal scholarship."

Deadline for proposals is 28 February 2023: https://mpilhlt.github.io/reference-extraction/workshop-2023/cfp/

#DH

Forgot what a banger (riffage and solo) this is once it gets going.

Incidentally, the song I played along with on my practice kit to prove to my Dad that I was "better than Ringo" (his choice, not mine) and that it was worth me buying an actual drum kit.

The idea then that Lars would one day be referred to as the "Ringo of metal" would be dismissed as being totally ridiculous.

#Metallica

title: Thrilling Adventures of Lovelace and Babbage - Arts at MIT

last_post.content:
You may know Charles Babbage and Ada Lovelace as important figures in the prehistory of the computational sciences.

If you're really lucky you've also read Sydney Padua's glorious graphic novel about them. That novel is now an opera, and if you happen to be near MIT at the right moment next month, you can go see it.

Here's a page: https://arts.mit.edu/projects/thrilling-adventures-of-lovelace-and-babbage/

Via an email to the Digital Classicist list, I’ve learned that the Centre for Language and Cognition at the University of Groningen has opened registration for a hybrid workshop 14-15 March 2023: “Computational Approaches to Ancient Greek and Latin (2nd edition)“. Registration for online participation is required by 13 March. More information and the program is available here: https://dcagreeklatin.web.rug.nl/

#Latin #AncientGreek #classics #DH
